title: What if I just use one part of a roundtrip ticket?
perex: Throwaway ticketing refers to the practice of deliberately using only the first leg of a cheaper round-trip itinerary to save money.
content:
To offer you the best price on your chosen route, we found that a round-trip ticket is actually cheaper than a one-way flight. However, the practice of “throwaway ticketing” — only using the first part of a round-trip ticket — is prohibited by a majority of airlines in their terms and conditions —- please review these terms of each chosen airline for more information.
Airlines may impose certain sanctions including invoicing an additional amount up to the standard fare of the one-way alternative, deletion of mileage programs, etc. Yet, the probability of this is minimal, because such a breach can only be identified after the flights have departed. 


By proceeding with this booking, you confirm that you are aware of all conditions and potential issues related with using just one leg of a round-trip itinerary. 
If you do not want to purchase an itinerary with throwaway segments, please return to our search page and choose a standard direct itinerary.
